item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 3, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Touchscreens are out, and tactile controls are back (320 points | 230 comments)
2. I couldn't find a free, no-login, no-AI checklist app–so I built one (32 points | 32 comments)
3. Create block devices on your computer backed by Redstone Memory (114 points | 20 comments)
4. A React Renderer for Gnome JavaScript (58 points | 11 comments)
5. Unix core utilities implemented in Haskell (148 points | 48 comments)
6. Speed, scale and reliability: 25 years of Google datacenter networking evolution (207 points | 39 comments)
7. GoGoGrandparent (YC S16) Is Hiring Back End and Full-Stack Engineers ( | hide)
8. Big Data for the Leviathan (25 points | 5 comments)
9. Programming Languages That Blew My Mind (2023) (5 points | discuss)
10. The AP has called winners in elections for more than 170 years. How it's done (22 points | 3 comments)
11. Venvstacks: Virtual Environment Stacks for Python (80 points | 28 comments)
12. Turn your phone or tablet into a chess clock (9 points | 5 comments)
13. Get me out of data hell (520 points | 200 comments)
14. The motor turns too much (342 points | 161 comments)
15. Ractor – a Rust Actor Framework (124 points | 57 comments)
16. How to Correctly Sum Up Numbers (21 points | 17 comments)
17. Eighty Years of the Finite Element Method (2022) (182 points | 90 comments)
18. Weird Lexical Syntax (398 points | 209 comments)
19. Next Generation Out of Band Garbage Collection (151 points | 74 comments)
20. If you need the money, don't take the job (214 points | 129 comments)
21. Spann: Highly-Efficient Billion-Scale Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search (2021) (110 points | 26 comments)
22. Matrix 2.0 Is Here (126 points | 43 comments)
23. SpawELO – small free matchmaking system for LAN parties (165 points | 44 comments)
24. The inventor of the automatic rice cooker (202 points | 172 comments)
25. Show HN: A minimalist (brutalist?) website for sharing all your links (267 points | 144 comments)
26. Show HN: Someday, Open-Source Calendly Alternative for Gmail / Google App Script (289 points | 49 comments)
27. Ask HN: What would you preserve if the internet were to go down tomorrow? (62 points | 82 comments)
28. Prisma Postgres – Runs on bare metal and unikernels (269 points | 131 comments)
29. Preserving the history of retiring cruise ships (38 points | 51 comments)
30. Hacking the T2S+ Out of Fear: Get Lock-In Thermography for Free (274 points | 42 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 3, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
